comments.author: coco
comments.content: Oh, wow, this is great! I looove poached eggs and we always have salsa verde around so this is an easy one.

comments.author: Kate
comments.content: This looks really interesting. I love poached eggs, but I've never seen them like this before. Can't wait to try it!

comments.author: Alison @ Wholesome Goodness
comments.content: Now these I have to make.  Pronto.  Thanks for the great idea!  I especially love how easy the homemade tomatillo salsa is.

comments.author: Layla
comments.content: This looks very good and making them with the tomatillo sauce is a great idea, I would really like to have these huevos ahogados for breakfast (regardless of having a hangover).

comments.author: Alisa@Foodista
comments.content: Oooh... I love it! Love poached eggs!

comments.author: Court
comments.content: This is brilliant.  I always struggle with poaching eggs, and this is the perfect solution and so much more.  Yumm...

comments.author: adam
comments.content: just made it: it's amazing. I added some verde hot sauce for some extra kick!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Nice! Thanks for letting me know.

comments.author: Anna
comments.content: Oh. Wow.  Found the recipe and threw it together for a quick dinner, using my own sauce.  I had  mine on polenta, and this is officially a favorite and a cravings-worthy dish.

comments.author: RH
comments.content:
The roasted poblano peppers are what really make Senor Moose's version sing.  SO.  FREAKING.  GOOD.

I always order mine with a side of avocado, then I mash it up in the broth and scoop it out again with the grilled bread.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Love the avocado trick! I appreciate you taking the time to comment. If you haven't already, I'd love it if you would join the Herbivoracious facebook page: http://www.facebook.com/herbivoracious Thanks, Michael

comments.author: sarah
comments.content: I made this for dinner last night and it was incredibly delicious.  Took about 5 minutes to make and only dirtied about 3 dishes, altogether! Definitely a make-again.
